Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aouni K
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, hotel, food and service. You are right in the middle of Rome. The staff is extremely friendly. The food is excellent. Higly recommended for passing few days in Rome since you save a lot in time and transportation to see the main city attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda kinky”
Reviews.Author: DianeGreen53
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel from December 1 to 4th 2011. It is close to most of the tourist sites in Rome and it is a bit unusual. The decor is a throw back to the 1960s with black and white lucite and lots of mirrors...even on the ceiling above our bed! The room was very small and we had lots of luggage as we had been touring Italy for 3 months, so it was even more cramped. We had a juliet balcony overlooking a tiny courtyard and a vent from the restaurant that sent delicious scents up to our room when we left the balcony door open..which was almost all the time as our room was so warm. The weather was unusually warm in Rome and it was easier to open the door than to try to cool the room. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom, although small, was pretty with all its marble walls. I was a bit disappointed with the size of the room but otherwise I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The staff were wonderful and the included breakfast was amazing. This hotel has several restaurants, and we tried them all. The food was wonderful and reasonably priced. If you are looking for something a bit different I would recommend you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Your Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: RobertPacifici
Reviews.Content: I had a fabulous stay here with my wife and kids for a combo business-trip/family-vacation. Location doesn’t get much better than this if you want to tour Rome by foot or by cab. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable and assisted with everything from baggage storage to coordinating our tours and meals. Speaking of meals, you’ve got to have breakfast and/or dinner up at “HiRes” on the roof of the hotel. This newly remodeled modern looking perch serves up good food and nice views. There is a piano bar in the lobby where the crazy Italian locals (and a few of us tourists as well) enjoy music, dancing and cocktails till 4am…what a scene!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Debra B
Reviews.Content: My Sister and I spent 4 days in Rome at Hotel valadier... We loved the location of the Hotel (it was 5 min walk to spanish Steps, 35 min to Coloseum/ Imperial Palace and 15 min to Vatican), hotel was clean. The Hotel was close to lots of restaurants and shops. We felt very safe at all times. We took the shuttle from the airport ( cost was 34.00)- it was great and took about 30-40 min.

Reviews.Title: “Best cocktail bar a hotel could have”
Reviews.Author: DariusGlaws
Reviews.Content: Pros Friendly and plentiful staff Giovanni in the bar makes the best cocktails u could ever want on a roof terrace in Rome Clean Quiet Awesome location Lovely social spaces (roof and ground floor bar) Lots of lifts too move u around hotel Cons (for balance) Rooms are small (but frankly u aren't in Rome to stay in ur hotel!) Breakfast options didn't involve Lincolnshire sausages and baked beans

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pamela M
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to Rome for a weekend...after reviewing hundreds of hotel we went with our first choice Hotel Valadier and thrilled we did. The hotel was perfect in so many ways. It cost approx $40 Euro (we shared a van with another couple) on our way to the hotel and $50 Euro when we left to the airport. The hotel was 5 minute walk to Spanish Steps, 15 minute walk to Vatican, 30 minute walk to the Colliseum, etc. The rooms were exceptionall clean and yes, there is a mirror above our bed...gave us a chuckle before the lights went out at night. We spent little time in our room as we were out all the time. I did not find it noisy at all throughout the night and often fell asleep with our window open which faced the main street. There was safe in our room. I gave the staff at the front my ipad for the day when we would go on on our way, as I did not have the right cord to charge it. They graciously did it for me. We did one tour of the city and the cost was minimum - it was a great way to see it all. But then we discovered that we could walk to see it all and we did. The hotel was in a safe area and most times we were heading back to our hotel at 1:00 in the morning and felt safe at all times.

Reviews.Title: “There was a mirrored ceiling above the bed.”
Reviews.Author: Michael R
Reviews.Content: First, the pros. This hotel is ideally located steps from the Piazza di Popolla and just off the Via del Corso. Also, for 110 EU a night, you really can't find less expensive in touristy Roma. Now the cons, this hotel is an absolute relic from the late 70's. Decorated with floor to ceiling (and sometimes also the ceiling) mirrors, heavy with black marble and high-gloss cherrywood built-in cabinetry, the interior of this boutique hotel resembles the hull of a mid-rate cruise ship. The halls are narrow, small, and disorienting (due to all the reflective surfaces) and the rooms are oddly layed-out, dark, and reminiscent of what you might find on the lower deck of a Princess cruise ship. The downstairs piano bar is decorated with glittering bedazzled artwork of Marilyn Monroe and a rhinestoned leopard lays languidly over the piano itself - Michael Jackson would love this place. I stayed here for four nights, on two nights I asked the concierge for dinner recommendations and was sent to two of the most touristy restaurants in Rome. The staff is certainly helpful, but not necessarily capable of much, but they do all that they can.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Pete-Evo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Great location for seeing Rome most sights in walking distance and the staff were frendly and spoke very good English. The rooms are small but comfortable and wewre clean, they could do with a facelift especially the bathrooms. Over all good value for money and with the service a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Trvl_Prncss
Reviews.Content: This hotel is decorated with lots of marble and lacquer. One can tell that back in maybe the 80s or 90s this was THE place. Still its a great location from which to explore Rome. The staff is extremely friendly and hardworking. The ladies that run the breakfast buffet in the morning are perfectionist, breakfast is always laid out on time and with great presentation. There is a variety to choose from for breakfast. The hotel rooms are small but all the rooms in Italy or for that matter European hotels are small. The hotel is located one block from Piazza del Popolo, 8 minute walk to Trevi Fountain, 5 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, 15 minute walk to Victor Emmanuelle monument and a leisurely 25 minute stroll to the Colosseum. To head to the Vatican I would recommend crossing over Via del Corso over to Via di Ripetta, take that down to Ara Pacis (10minute walk), cross the bridge (Ponte Cavour), 10 minutes to Castel St. Angelo and 15 more minutes walk from Castel up to St. Peter's Basilica. You could access all of the major sites on foot from this base. If you choose to take a cab, its about 8-10euro to the Vatican just as a guideline leaving from the hotel about 8am on a weekday. We had a corner room on the fourth floor which was bright, airy and clean. There is piano bar downstairs where you can lounge after a day of walking and enjoy a glass of wine. During the weekends the bar does get busy.

Reviews.Title: “THIEVES”
Reviews.Author: TassieTravellers2011
Reviews.Content: We went for this hotel because of the reviews, big tip, stay away at all costs. There is a scammer on every Rome corner. This hotel is no different. You are greeted by a very unfriendly ironlady who doesnt really want to be there. After a mazy hike you find your room. The real issue we had with this hotel is the dishonest staff, including the night bar prices, US $15 for a beer, and US $25 for a very ordinary tasting champagne. Day prices vary considerably. Don't leave anything behind in this hotel, consider it gone!! We will never go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located Charmer”
Reviews.Author: oenophile1230
Reviews.Content: My travel agent had suggested this hotel. It is one block from the Piazza del Popolo and in the center of everything. Metro and bus are nearby and you can walk everywhere. The rooms were beautiful. I had a corner room on the fifth floor. It was bright and airy with two balconies and a view of the Villa Borghese. The rooftop bar and restaurant were great and the lobby bar was wonderful. The staff was extremely helpful. This is a real keeper.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: Cheb
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to very clean and friendly. As everyone has said the location is excellent and this is what you are paying for. We stayed on the 5th floor and had no problems with the sound from the piano bar. The room (standard double) was possibly the smallest room we have ever stayed in europe. Just a word of warning, even if the hotel call you a taxi to the airport and say it will be fixed EUR40 reconfirm this price with the taxi driver before you get in. Our driver took us on an' extended route' to the airport and charged by the meter even though we were told it would be a fixed EUR40 after a heated discussion we paid 50. Always double check prices in Rome, we found extras 'errors' added onto most of our bills in restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but some odd quirks”
Reviews.Author: forexport
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as my usual hotel in room was fully booked and I just needed a room for one night on a business trip. Its an odd hotel, obviously had a lot of money spent on it in the 1980s, lots of black and yellow marble and quirky statues, pictures, smoked mirrors and pillars everywhere. My single room had a huge bed with not much space around it. TV had a great choice of Sky channels - but I couldn't turn it off with the remote and had to climb on the furniture to reach the off switch on the monitor. The first chilly evening of autumn, I was quite cold at night but the bed only had a sheet on it,no blanket. There was no blanket in the wardrobe either, so I improvised by using bath towels to try to keep warm. Oh, and the ceiling had a big octagonal mirror on it. The breakfast was a generous buffet with very pleasant staff, reception staff weren't so welcoming. Its not an expensive hotel and I expect the larger rooms were more comfortable. The location is great - so ok if you take on board the quirks and check out the spare blanket and TV when you arrive!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely! I couldn't say it better.”
Reviews.Author: mniNJ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our visit to Rome, and were fortunate to stay at Hotel Valadier. A previous reviewer, Dancingberlioz, said in her October review much as I would say. We were in a junior suite, and it was quite spacious. The bathroom area was roomy also, and there was plenty of storage areas for our clothing and such. (To my fellow American travellers, this is Europe; it is not the Hyatt or even the Hampton Inn you are used to in the U.S.; usually the rooms are smaller, and if there is a closet and two drawers, you are fortunate.) The room was immaculate when we arrived, and kept so by a very active and competent housekeepint staff. Extra towels were readily available. The breakfast served was plentiful and varied; one does not usually expect eggs to be included in a European breakfast, but it was here. The waitstaff was on top of seating and the coffee service, and attended to everyone's needs promptly and with big smiles. The front desk staff were very knowledgable and accommodating; Silvia and Federica in Reservations, and Stefano and his associate in Reception helped us with communication confusions while we were planning our trip. A BIG thank-you to all of them. I hope a return trip allows us to visit Hotel Valadier in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Dmc56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very comfortable and well located. It's within walking distance of everything, including the heart of the best shopping district! The staff provided good service and were very helpful. I would recommend not eating at the Hi-Res rooftop restaurant. The service was terrible, many mistakes were made and too expensive for the quality. I will book my next stay at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for shopaholics!)))”
Reviews.Author: Dzhavad M
Reviews.Content: Good hotel! Located in the tourist heart of Rome! Great location! Insufficiently spacious rooms! Very good service and polite staff! A good restaurant with an open terrace on the top floor! Great food for breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly little hotel”
Reviews.Author: dancingberlioz
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended this hotel, saying the location was unbeatable - he was right! Just a short walk gets you to the Spanish Steps, a 25 minute stroll gets you to Castel Sant' Angelo and the Vatican and if you want to explore further afield or don't want to walk, the Metro is just the other side of the Piazza del Popolo. The area is just as lovely in the evening as it is in the daytime - you feel perfectly safe walking around the streets, also the shops, restaurants and cafes stay open late so the family feel continues well into the evening - something I wouldn't say about my local town! However, it is not just the location we fell in love with - the hotel is small and the rooms are unusually shaped but they are immaculate and we loved the art Deco styling. Some people on here have said they thought the decor was too dark but, after a day in bright sunlight and 40 degree heat it was a cool and calm haven. We were a party of 6 - my husband, myself and my teenaged son in one triple room and my sister with her teenaged son and daughter in another; both rooms were perfectly big enough for 3 adults and we found the beds very comfortable. Some people might not like the fact that every room is different but, for us, it just added to the ambience. As you walk round the hotel there is a surprise round every corner - a statue, little cabinets of ornaments, a hidden door! - we loved it! The breakfast was well cooked and well laid out, with something for everyone in our group (although I wasn't sure about my son wanting to breakfast on chocolate cake!). The Piano Bar is stuffed with comfortable sofas and armchairs - just what you want after a hard day sightseeing! The staff were extremely welcoming and very helpful, speaking perfect English and being polite enough not to laugh at my attempts at Italian! The Reception staff were a mine of information about tours, local buses, the location of the nearest bank, corner shop and even organised our transport back to the airport which gave us a hassel-free end to our stay. We will go back to Rome (we've thrown our coins in the Trevi Fountain to be sure!) and we will definitely go back to Hotel Valadier as they made us feel so very welcome and comfortable. Those who like big, anonymous, corporate style hotels will be disappointed - but anyone with the soul to truly appreciate Rome won't be!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbie W
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome and I can't wait to go back. Hotel Valadier is just lovely. Situated in Via Della Fontanella, a quiet lane just off from The Piazza Del Popolo, it is stylish and beautifully decorated. Staff are extremely polite and helpful and speak very good English. Rooms were spacious and cleaned daily. Breakfast was wonderful; something for everyone. Lovely ice cream shop just opposite which was delicious (Gelati e Papere). Spanish Steps was literally a 3 minute stroll from the hotel and the main musts for sight seeing were a maximum of 25 minutes walk, although the metro runs a regular and efficient service. The whole area has a wonderful night life which is great for families; cafes, shops, bars and restaurants stay open til late. Lovely, safe atmosphere. Would thoroughly recommend it to anyone. xx

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and far too expensive”
Reviews.Author: adntar
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this once-glamorous hotel because of a sudden change in plans and were charged the full price, 370 euros per night for a double room (we got two). Immediately we were struck by the sombreness of the hall (it's actually in the basement) and the 1980s decorations; the receptionist was kind but not as much as you would expect for the price we were paying, and the rooms were very big but old and not renovated, with an outdated air conditioner and no toothbrush or slippers. On the plus side, the location is very central, a few hundred meters away from Piazza del Popolo (People's Square) and very close to Corso Italia, a major shopping artery. Still, this doesn't justify the excessive price we paid for an outdated hotel in bad need of a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and nice location”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey11
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 11 staying at Hotel Valdier and upon arrival, they were short a triple room and upgraded one of our rooms to a suite. The hotel itself was clean and had a great ambiance. However, there are mirrors all over which can leave you a bit confused at times. The rooms that we had that were not suites, were a little small, but suitable. The breakfast was the best we had on our 2 week trip around Italy. The hotel is within walking distance of the Spanish Steps (10 mins), Trevi Fountain (15 mins) and Pantheon (15 mins). However, if you wanted to walk to the other attractions, it is possible. The staff was friendly. I would recommend this hotel to someone looking for a nice hotel on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “If I lived in Rome, this would be home!”
Reviews.Author: JANETOntari0
Reviews.Content: Italy, it was my dream for so long! It became a reality, with a much anticipated 2 week adventure with my husband. We planned plenty, but only booked 3 nights stay for our first week. We planned for an adventure, doing much like our son and "flying by the seat of our pants." Learning to backpack at our age! I booked our first 2 nights at the Valadier, knowing that we would have to come back to Rome for 2 more nights during our trip. We planned on doing some travelling around Italy then returning for 1 more night prior to a cruise and then returning for 1 final night prior to flying back to Canada. I only booked the first 2 nights at the Valadier because as we all know sometimes booking on the internet can be scary. We decided that if the hotel proved to be good we would return to it. It was! It was all that and more! The front desk staff was the first clue. Helpful, humourous and encouraging to our adventure. They guided us to tourist areas, gave us tips and booked our visit to the Vatican. And always offered to do more! Constantly answering our questions - perfect english- and always welcoming us back as though we were family! The rooms, we had 3 diferent styles during our repeat visits to the hotel, were amazingly clean, stylish and comfortable. The breakfast was one of the very best we had in Italy, and we travelled! The location of the hotel, right off the Spanish steps was central and perfect for evening strolls and daytime walk abouts. Magnificient restaurants at an arms reach. All in all, we plan on going back and would not even think of staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory For Us But Not For Others”
Reviews.Author: foodloverinbucks
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a four night break. Booked package with Expedia for Triple Room. Room was small but it was clean and served 2 adults and 1 child perfectly. Walking distance to Popolo Metro. Pizza Restaurant next to hotel is OK and you get 10% discount if you dine in one of two hotel restaurants which works out reasonable. Always overheard people were complaining to reception about their room being too small or cleaners had left their door wide open, so always lock your stuff in safe! Location was perfect to most places it is right on Val de Corso (hope spelling right!) which is main shopping street that goes on forever! No kettles in bedroom so couldn't make yourself a drink in the evening. There are toiletries, slippers, fresh towels in bedroom. Alike the other reviews the rooms are so dark, not much natural light. We specifically asked for a quiet room and higher floor, we stayed on 4th floor and it was definitely better as it was at the end of the corridor so there wasn't anyone walking past your door late at night disturbing you! We were worried about the top level restaurant so 4th floor seems quiet enough. The complimentary Wifi seemed to be fine for the ipod and iphone, but not the ipad for some reason!! Breakfast was OK. Cereal, Bacon, Sausages, Scrambled (Microwave) and Boiled Eggs, Toast, Grilled Veg, Cheese, Cakes!! The choice was OK but boring after a couple of days. Tea, Coffee and not nice juices! Reception staff were not particulary friendly as they seemed to be hassled with complaints most of the time. Beware as when we asked them about discounts for restaurants within the hotel group it seemed to vary 5% to 10% for hotel restaurants although it is clearly advertised that it is 10% discount. Generally OK and would probably not go there again as would like to try somewhere different next time. Walking distance to Popolo, Spanish Steps and a little further to Trevi Fountain although do able! There is a 117 Small bus which takes you down the street as we had our Roma passes it seemed to serve us well as transport was included and kids under travel free on most public transport.

Reviews.Title: “very good - very central - great staff and good hotel”
Reviews.Author: phadreus
Reviews.Content: a good central place - the rooms are bizzare and the hotel is as well but very good - the breakfast that is included is very good and has a bottomless cup of coffee which u never get in rome !

Reviews.Title: “Was OK”
Reviews.Author: cats68
Reviews.Content: The best part is location . You are a couple of minutes walk from the Spanish Steps in a quiet lane . I had asked for a non smoking room when i got in late at night the room was smelling of smoke . I got all the smoke from the other rooms coming in . The room was small so the smoke did not go away . Very small bathroom . I asked to be moved the lady on the desk was not that nice but did move me in the end to a room on top floor better size room but being under the restaurant you had chairs moving and people till late . Then to get woken from the staff talking and running up and down stairs in front of my room . The store room was there so they didn't care people are trying to sleep . Its not that cheap so i at least wanted a good nights sleep . Hotel is nice inside but dark .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great rooftop terrace”
Reviews.Author: CamilaMeca
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to Rome, and the location can't be beat. It is steps from Piazza del Popolo and 5 minutes walking from Piazza di Spagna. The hotel is very charming, very clean rooms, helpful and welcoming staff. The rooftop terrace is a lovely spot, well decorated, with a nice view, and the food is absolutely amazing. I also met very nice people who advised me nice things to do, like just get lost and enjoy Rome. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: pg132
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to stay at Hotel Valadier by family and ended up loving it too. Although an older style hotel in terms of decor, the location near Piazza del Popolo and Via del Corso was perfect to explore Roma! We stayed in a Superior Bamboo room which was relatively modern, clean and spacious (for Rome standards!). we had views of the surrounding buildings through the windows. The hotel also offers free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel and in the rooms which was extremely handy for us! One of the best parts for us was the extensive buffet breakfast served each morning in the breakfast room. The gentleman running the show was extremely friendly and attentive and the food on offer included: cheeses, cold meats, cereals, croissants, brioche, yoghurt, multiple juices and of course a lovely cappuccino to start the day! The only downside to our stay was that our room was located on level 5 right beneath the rooftop terrace which was apparently very popular at night! We did not go there at all but we certainly heard everything that happened up there - the music, the people, chairs scraping the floor...not good for jet lag! The price of the hotel for location and amenities was very reasonable and despite the aforementioned issue we would stay at Hotel Valadier again.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Magic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Luoca
Reviews.Content: I often go fo business in Rome and I think that the Hotel Valadier is one the mosto beatifull and charming hotel in the magic Rome. I f you go in Rome for business or holiday you have to stay in this amazing hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Completely satisfied with my stay in Valadier”
Reviews.Author: aleksandra_here
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Valadier for 6 days in June, travelled alone. Though there are many reviews about the small rooms, the room I was given was quite spacious! Air conditioning worked, the room was clean, as well as the bathroom. Comfortable closets for clothes. Rome is a noisy city, and noisiness is not the problem of the hotel. I woke up one morning from the manifistations in Piazza del Popolo. The hotel in general has a unique interior design. I loved the darkened corridors, gold and black, marble. The rooms are very modern and stylish. But it was hard at first to find the room and navigate through the corridors. I managed, though!) The breakfast was excellent. Really, the mozzarella is just amazing!)) Loved the breakfasts! Staff is very helpful, informative and friendly. The Wi-fi worked. No problems. Yes. The location is perfect. In the heart of Rome, very convenient. I also recommend the restaraunt Il Brillo Parlante - it's just outside the hotel. Excellent wine and tasty pizza! And it works till 2 in the morning, can you imagine? that's rare for Rome)) The upstairs restaurant HiRes is also opened until 2 AM. Great service and super-tasty fish. Beautiful view from the opened area of the restaurant, saw the fool moon. Romantic music plays through the night. I really enjoyed my stay! There are reasons to come back to Valadier!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, unique atmosphere but challenging to get to your room.”
Reviews.Author: naturalinokc
Reviews.Content: Overall I'm glad we were here. I'm sure there are other nice properties in the area but this was OK. You needed a GPS to negotiate the stairs, turns, doors and elevators but I'm betting this is the case with many of the hotels located in the heart of Rome. Rooftop bar and restaurant were nice to visit, but way overpriced. The staff was nice and polite. No extras though. Room service was prompt and the breakfast was excellent! Service was great at breakfast as well. They need to put different sculptures on each floor so you don't get confused on the hike to your room. I am a smoker and found the smoking rules were a bit silly. No smoking in rooms or in the downstairs bar until after 10:00 pm. You could go on the roof to smoke or hide out as the staff does in a bathroom and smoke by the window. Thought this was funny to see the room attendant sneaking out of bathroom leaving her smokes tucked away in there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and even better location”
Reviews.Author: ThePookies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great place, 30 seconds from Pizza del popolo, and 2 minutes from the Spanish stairs. The rooms are very clean and elegant and the staff are nice and welcoming. Breakfast - very good and rich. Internet - free WiFi in the rooms with good signal and speed. In short - Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but only average hotel, and ok if you need a room for 3 adults”
Reviews.Author: ADTravelBlog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Valadier with my wife and brother in September-2011. Summary review as follows:- Good points + unbeatable location + rooms for 3 people Bad points - weak air conditioning made the room stuffy - odd layout so if you stay in the 'other part' of the hotel, you have to take an elevator up then come back down again to get to your room Since there were three of us, we opted to choose a hotel that could cater for a single room that could take 3 adults. The Valadier fit that bill, the location really was excellent, and for a Rome hotel the price was not that bad. Overall though, when I next come to Rome I'll look to try another hotel assuming I do not still need something for three adults.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for the money”
Reviews.Author: liorv3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Valadier Hotel in Jan. 2011 . The rooms were horrible - UnClean , very (!) small , there wasn't a hot water in the bathroom . There staff were nice and breakfast was average . The only possitive thing is that the location is Excellent ! This is max. a low standart of 3* hotel , not value for the money - and the hotel is expensive .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel to avoid”
Reviews.Author: Alkees_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed in hotel Valadier in Rome and the only thing i 'll remember is how small,smelly,hot,noisy and expensive it is.Well decorated,yes,but is it worth it?is the great location enough for 377 euros for three nights when you can barely move inside the room?Don't mention slow wi-fi connection...The choise is yours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lumamahdi
Reviews.Content: Near almost everything.. You can walk or take the bus. Internet service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: beverley_evans3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated between the Spanish Steps and Piazza del Popolo, Its central location means that all the major tourist sites are in reasonable walking distance. The reception staff are very welcoming and were happy to assist by calling the local taxi company when we needed confirmation of our transport arrangements to the airport, The Hotel is quite dark and has no windows so can feel oppresive. Some of the rooms are small and ours 311, was very warm and the air conditioning did not work in the bedroom, we opened the window but the external air conditioning was placed below our window and was so noisy we had to shut it again. On our last morning we had no hot water. We had the B&B option and the breakfast was lovely , plenty of choice enough to fill you in readiness for a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location with good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: steptravel
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 5 nights here and overall liked the property. The look of the commons areas was very sleek and Art Deco. It was not a bargain stay, but I think their prices fluctuate wildly depending on season, and the rates do include complete breakfast. Breakfast included cappuccino (or whatever coffee you want), canned-style fruit, several fruit juices, few fresh fruits, couple dry cereals, scrambled eggs, scary bacon, hot-dog-like sausages, fresh pastries/donuts, cold cuts/cheese and rolls, yogurt. So fill up on breakfast for your Rome trekking. Our room for 2 was very small, but expected for Europe. The 2 twin beds were pushed together, but made up separately. Window overlooking the "alley" (street) the hotel is located on so could gauge weather before leaving. My first shower there, the water was barely warm. Told the front desk and we didn't have that problem again. Our sink had a drainage problem but we made our own solution. The toilet had problems fully flushing, which caused a slight odor. Nice full wardrobe to store clothes/shoes. Confusing SkyTV system, which didn't have great news channels and was difficult to navigate. Didn't find that many affordable restaurants nearby, at least not as many as Piazza Navona area, where I would stay next time. This hotel located right at Piazza Popolo, and walking distance to Trevi, 7 min to Spanish Steps, can walk to lots else too, depending on how much you like to walk. Room was nice and warm which was great since weather was cold during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Roman Hotel. Great Location, Great Service, and Fun Lobby Bar.”
Reviews.Author: Chic2SD
Reviews.Content: Through the North End of Rome we had the pleasure of staying at this beautiful establishment. I would personally like to thank all the hotel staff and workers for their amazing service while my wife and I spent Christmas there from San Diego, CA. We walked in and were quickly greeted with bag service, bonus right there! Juliette who checked us in, was a great help for us throughout our trip as well. Tucked between two main streets and a huge Piazza was our hotel. Sidenote: the best pizza and pasta place we had in Roma was right next to this hotel. We shared a slice on Christmas Eve with Alec Baldwin there. Also, went back again and had some amazing Tortellini. At this point I will let you find your own Pizzeria. But if you want to take my word on this: Head to Babuino, take a right, and it's the first pizzeria on the right. I believe next to an art Studio. About 50 steps from the front. Our Room was just perfect for the two of us. Great upper mirror above the bedroom, full sky TV, and hot shower. I would have to say the maid service was great as well. Our room was always clean. We dined at the IL Brillo Parlante, and a great experience for our first night. Late dining is great here as we were the only Americans dining their, in a packed room. Definetly go here for some great food at this fun Ristorante. 2 people about $60.00. Also, the continental session in the mornings was a great way to fuel up, and enjoy some delicious cured meats, bread, and cheese. The staff in the mornings was excellent and they served as Barristas by serving us Espresso's, Latte's, etc... At this point, I would like to disclose one of the hidden treasures that makes this hotel fun and that is the bar downstairs near the lobby. Let's just say I had some Vegas experience nights at this place during my stay. Smoking inside, beautiful women dancing to the tunes of a Italian Man singing: cool Jazz, slow blues, and rock hits. It felt like a scene out of the 50's. A fun night here will cost you about $75.00 bucks, but well worth it if you like to party. A bit loud but hey it's a big city environment, and this place is a treat to have in your hotel. A lot of pretty women in anyone's liking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and modern but still with charm”
Reviews.Author: BigCityTraveler
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughter, husband, and I stayed in a triple room in the annex of the Hotel Valadier for 6 days in November. The room was large enough for that amount of time and the street was very quiet. Bathroom was very clean, as modern as Rome gets, and spacious by European standards. The triple room does not have a divider between sections of the room, although the bathroom is a separate room (shower only). Service was helpful and always on time (no delays, everything as expected). The restaurant next door is great, especially for a first stop upon jet-lagged arrival. The one odd thing was the location of the room in the annex - the building literally has 2 floor 5s. We would take the elevator from the lobby, get off on 5, walk up 3 steps and down a all, through an unmarked door, up two sets of stairs, through another unmarked door and finally to our room. We never could get back through the hallway doors (which locked and didn't always have an entry slot) to go back down to the lobby--so we had to go all the way down to the first floor (via stairs) and out on to the street & turn the corner to get back into the hotel! The location of the hotel is quite nice if you want to spend a lot of time in the historic center. It's very close to Popolo and the Borghesa park (lots of green and space to walk and grab some quiet) and it's not far to the Spanish steps and major shopping & some lovely restaurants. It's a bit of a jog to ancient Rome (and of course you'll spend the whole time walking around those sites), so I suggest cabbing or grabbing the subway down & back for that trek. Same with a trip to the Vatican, especially because you have to cross through busy traffic to get there. The downside (sort of) is that the internet never worked, period. They offer wireless and wired--and i've used both, often, around the world, but the thing just never worked. Glad I had my smartphone for the basics and for such a short, liesure-oriented trip, that was fine.

Reviews.Title: “First Time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: nephwop
Reviews.Content: Found the Hotel Valadier to be in an excellent location, right near Piazza Di Popolo and right off Via Corso. Could walk almost anywhere we wanted to go, the Vatican, Collosseum, Forum, Piazza Venezia, Navona, Trevi etc. I am 6 foot 3 and 300#. I must say, the rooms are small but I still found them comfortable and clean. The breakfast had great fresh fruit, kiwis, oranges and was well worth it. I only had a glass of wine in the Lobby Bar and the restaurant Il Brillo, which were ok, The Barolo at Il Brillo was a little corked, but I only had a glass. I did not try Hi Res on this trip. Excellent coffee bar right in the Piazza where I had a daily cafe doppio. I might want a bigger hotel next time, but for the price and the fact that we were hardly ever in the room.....I thought it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Exeptionel”
Reviews.Author: natasha47
Reviews.Content: Very chic hotel ,beautiful décor ,beautiful rooms ,comfortable beds ,nice atmosphere and very clean.Granite and marble everywhere ,I would rate this hotel luxurious.Central location.My husband and I went twice to the Hi-Res restaurant it's a bit pricey but it's worth every penny,the food is exquisite ,very refined.I recommend it.If you want to have some thing reasonable and and excellent food you can go to Brillo Parlante it's just next door.if i return to Rome again ,i will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The most noise I've ever heard in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: bginty
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the staff was friendly, but I've never been in a hotel with that much noise. Plus, the room we had was just big enough to fit the bed. I've seen bigger rooms on cruise ships. The 70's porn decor was very interesting though. I've never slept in a room with mirrors on all 4 walls and 1 on the ceiling. Not worth the price at all. The bar on the rooftop has a great view, but be prepared to pay double the price for your drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Over my expectations”
Reviews.Author: AriBsAs
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my sister and adult nephew. We had booked a triple room and we found that the room was a small apartmente where I could sleep with my nephew and my sister in the other room. Yes, the space is very small but enough for Rome and where you only will sleep in such an amazing city. The beds are comfortable. Our room was quiet, in the 5th floor and full of light. Breakfast is superb, Didn't even have to have lunch! We got a great deal, and when we came back to Rome from the south to spend one more night after a week, they gave us a room that was really big. The bathroom with toilet and shower separated, two sinks, and white marbles. Amazing space for our last day in Rome. This hotel is perfectly located. Absolutly over my expectations. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but rooms are small, dark and noisy”
Reviews.Author: iTraveling
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day later than expected due to a Eurorail mishap that stranded us in Naples overnight. Hotel Valadier has a 48 hour cancellation policy (instead of the usual 24) and would not budge on refunding us for the night we didn't stay there. Our room was small, dark, and was on the first floor with no view at all from the window due to an overhang that blocked the window. The bed was rock hard! On the plus side, there was a mirror on the ceiling. We didn't sleep much due to the street noise and hard bed, so we asked to switch rooms to a higher floor. Our bags were moved the next day and the second room was quieter, the bed was a bit softer, but the room was even smaller. The shower pressure in both rooms was barely enough to get all the shampoo out of my hair. When we asked for a restaurant recommendation, they suggested the hotel restaurant. We asked for a cab to the airport and they called a cab without a meter and we were charged 50 euro for the trip. We haven't stayed at any other hotels in Rome, so this may be a good deal for the price, but it didn't live up to the other hotels we stayed at in Italy and is certainly not the same as a 4 star hotel in the US. The location is ideal. It is in a nice little shopping district within walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, and the Pantheon. We also walked to the Colosseum and the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Khayalake
Reviews.Content: It was a compact room (slightly masculine) but was clean and modern. The restaurant is worth eating at, even at the price, although I was dissapointed with a €15 cocktail that was served with a slightly dishevelled strawberry on the rim as garnish. Sorry, but I'm a stickler for the "nice touch" when paying that for a drink after a days worth of walking! Food was great. Our 5th floor room was slightly noisy as well as we were directly below the terrace restaurant, lots of sliding chairs etc. I would go here again, purely for simplicity and location's sake. It's in a great area of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “HI-Res roof top restaurant well equipped for rain!”
Reviews.Author: pindawal
Reviews.Content: Large roof top restaurant with a retractable roof which we needed because of rain. There is nothing notable to the view except for other roof top restaurants, homes and domes so if you are looking for a restaurant with views of something specific then there are better choices out there. Wait staff was attentive, good wine menu and English menus. The mango/apple/walnut salad came with no dressing. The crispy wonton chicken salad was delicious. The waiter graciouly returned our Danish prime beef for more cooking and the mussels and the sea bream were excellent. Unfortunately, all the pasta dishes included some kind of fish.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunny777
Reviews.Content: The Valadier hotel is in a great spot in central Rome - a short walk to the Spanish steps and Trevei fountain. It's surrounded, as one would expect in the area, by a multitude of restaurants and shops. However, I had been expecting a bit more. In an ancient city, I'm not sure how picky I can realistically be about room size. Yes, rooms here are small - but without gut renovations, most places in Rome are sure to be similarly space-challenged. Rooms are modern and well-appointed if a bit too masculine/gentleman's boudoir for my taste (dark marble, dark wood, and the coup de grace, an octagonal mirror above the bed). Shower is good, but the hair dryer is the old-style vacuum-on-the-wall-with-no-power type. The business center is very cramped and inconvenient and in order to use the internet from the room, you first need to visit the front desk to pay up and get a password (a bit inconvenient if you've already settled in for the night). MInibar was stocked, but when I opened a bottle of white wine, it had completely spoiled (it tasted like tap water) - however, this was quickly reconciled and I was never charged. Finally, the front desk could have been more helpful in offering restaurant tips -- upon request, I was directed towards the pricy Hi-Res on the rooftop, which I opted against. I don't know Rome all that well - this was my first stay in the City Center, so I'm not really sure what the competition is. The hotel is certainly clean, safe, and in a great spot. However, I'd likely try someplace else on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Valadier is the perfect location for access to everything”
Reviews.Author: coupleanddaughter
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Valadier for 2 nights after a 7 day cruise out of Rome. We arrived in the morning and as our room was not ready, they held our bags while we explored for the day. Upon our return at 6, our bags were in our very spacious room (a triple). This hotel is within easy walking distance to the Spanish Steps; just a little bit further is the the Trevi Fountain. The pleasant walk takes you along a very elegant shopping route. The rooftop bar is very scenic, but a bit pricey ( beer 8 euro, glass of wine 10 euro) We enjoyed the lounge in the evening with our 10 year old daughter. The piano bar and dancing ( even on a Sunday night) was fun. Breakfast offered a nice selection of fruit, meats and cheeses, pastries and eggs, along with good, robust coffee. My requested milk came back steamed in a pitcher which made the coffee wonderful! Our only negative was the yogurt was not chilled. The room was very nice with good A/C. Maybe its an American thing, but the 2 pillows were not sufficient for comfort, so be sure to ask for extra. The bed was firm, but we were so tired, we were fine. Our daughter's bed was super comfy. The bathroom was full sized, but quite dimly lit, which makes it tough to apply make-up. Luckily, we had a nice window in the room to use for natural light. Would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: LeanneM2
Reviews.Content: Nice location on the northern piece of Rome. I was about a half hour walk to the coloseum, 20 minutes to the Trevi Fountain. (for mid 20 year olds). SMALL rooms, even for Rome. Hotel needed an update, ie new beds (those were HARD AS A ROCK) and updated decor. Bathroom was actually large compared to the rest of the room. Full size shower. Small restaurante / lounge on premises.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive hotel with ideal location. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: sunbl0ck
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good hotel. Very near the piazza di Popolo and the Flaminio metro station. Clean, with impressive luxurious design. Marble everywhere. Helpful and polite staff that spoke fluently both French and English. Variety on the breakfast buffet, and tasty as well. Huge double bed even in the economy "classic" room. Bathroom amenities such as hair shampoo, shower gel, beauty kit, intimate cleaner gel and they replaced everything everyday. It even has a bidet. Magnetic cards instead of keys and a safe inside the room fro your valuables. Lastly, it's inside the shopping area of Rome. There are hundreds of brands and shops in a walking distance around the hotel. The neighbourhood feels like a shopping mall. Some small disadvantages: Air-conditioning wasn't activated. No matter the temperature settings it only produced external air. There was a bar just under our window that produced some crowd-noise around midnight, and bottle rattling around 7 in the morning. I didn't hear a thing as I am a heavy sleeper, and the room has double sound-proof windows, but my partner woke-up at several instances. Room was quite small, but cleverly designed. Mirror on the ceiling and hidden lighting. You get charged for internet access, and there is no nearby internet cafe, contrary to what another reviewer wrote.

Reviews.Title: “You dont always get what you pay for...but hey ! That's Rome !!”
Reviews.Author: Nick05
Reviews.Content: I draw a strong similarity between going to Rome and going to my wedding. You know you are going to have a great time, but you also know that you will have to just close your eyes and be prepared to pay up for the experience. Value is relative. The roof top terrace bar / restaurant is expensive but any rooftop terrace in Rome is .The rooms are small but they and the bathroom are clean . We had room 502 at the rear of the hotel and had no issues with noise. The staff are courteous and effecient. The breakfast buffet is ample and varied. You simply cant beat the location. Gripes ? The hairdryer barely worked which wasnt an issue for someone follically challenged such as myself but my wifes cries of angst suggested her displeasure. Who needs a mirror on the ceiling ? Internet access is slow and expensive but there's an interent cafe around the corner. They charge you to access regular satellite TV channels so all you can watch is RAI . And finally was it really necessary for the cleaner to vacum the hallway at 8 am on a Sudnay morning ? My benchmark of a hotel is would I return. To the Valadier ? Yes .

Reviews.Title: “Hi Res Restaurant was Good”
Reviews.Author: NJ-Eric
Reviews.Content: We had a better experience it seems than the prior reviewer. The view was nice in May, and the room temperature is managed nicely by heaters and fans and manipulation of the clear plastic roof. The service was exceptional and we liked the food. The clientele was a bit upscale as was the resaurant. It was somewhat pricey. When we got to the point of a tip, I wanted to leave 35 euroes, but only had 2 twenties. As I was puzzling over how to handle this, the waiter came over and pretty clearly decided I was trying to figure out how to get change and leave less than a twenty. So he sort of gathered up one of the the 20s, told me it was the right tip, and scurried off. It it hadn't ended up saving me 15 euroes I probably would have been irritated, but given the full set of facts it made my day! Every other aspect of the dinner was without incident.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation Weekend”
Reviews.Author: littlevino
Reviews.Content: I ma not one to impart negative reviews..... but my experience was so bad that i feel impelled. I was sent to Hi Res by the concierge of a nearby hotel. I am not sure if kick backs are involved, but the food at Hi Res was so terrible, that I would not feed it to my dog. Now this sounds terribly harsh. But, I am one of those travelers who is very content with a 3 euro slice of pizza from any street vendor. I tried, really did, but i could not gnaw my way through the gristle and bone of the ossobucco nor stomach the butter and salt quantity poured on my pasta. After a very polite complaint, I was informed that there was no chef. So not sure who was cooking. But to spend 140 euros on dog food, was an unpleasant experience. Notably, there was not one single patron in the restaurant who was Italian. Big hint. This is a tourist trap. Please beware!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at the Valadier Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: vincent1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights with friends at the valadier and it was wonderful !!! the staff was so nice and the receptionnists so helpful, they helped us to do a lot of things in Rome ! The breakfast was really good and the buffet so rich Our rooms were tiny but confortable and with nice decoration, they offered us to get bigger rooms with a small supplement if we wanted. But I loved the first one ! The girl at the front desk was always smiling and she was ready to help everybody ! it was wonderful to speak with her I will never forget our stay. We already miss Rome. Thank you Juliette and the Valadier staff

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sttimmj1
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel fab location.Room very nice but not enough lights!! Difficult reading in the dark!! Hotel has a theme of a luxury boat with marble surroundings, Roof top bar is a lovely location but not much of a view and prices were ridiculous!! Only bought two drinks which cost 15 euros each!! Handy for the spanish steps,piazza Navona,Pantheon and a nice walk to the Colosseum.Already read on one review that the hotels taxi driver dropped them off at the wrong terminal at the airport! This happened to us-Taxi driver took 40 mins to pick us up at the hotel and then drove ridiculously slow to the airport and then dropped us off at the wrong terminal??? Much better to walk to the nearby piazza and get cab from there

Reviews.Title: “Hi Res Restaurant No Prize”
Reviews.Author: BuffCrone
Reviews.Content: I was sent to Hi Res by the concierge of a nearby hotel. First, despite the glass walls, there is no view, because you cannot see the Piazza at night. Instead, you get a chilly, drafty dinner. On the plus side, the restaurant is hip and interesting and the bar seems lively. The restaurant has the most interesting restroom in all of Rome, which includes a porthole into the restaurant! The food was fair but expensive for what you got. The service, at first attentive, deteriorated dramatically as the restaurant got busy with a couple of large parties. I nearly had to tackle my server to get a check. For a drink at sunset, this place would be great. But go there for the view, not the food.

Reviews.Title: “Central”
Reviews.Author: schweppes41379
Reviews.Content: very nice and comfortable and calm. Roof terrace, good service.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE.... No updates needed!”
Reviews.Author: bruceleelaroche
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic 3 bedroom, 2 bath apartment. If you are looking for a place that is convenient, quiet and clean....here it is. It's not spotless because it is used, so new grout in some places would be nice in the bathrooms, but I've stayed at 5 star "L" hotels in Rome that need the same thing...so if you are a perfectionist and that sort of stuff bothers you, you're out of luck. The kitchen was very functional and we were able to cook breakfast and dinner many times, which saved us some money. I could not believe how quiet this place was (as compared with most Rome hotels). I still used ear plugs to keep out the ocassional noise. The pictures on this site are very accurate. This is a place I would definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but stylish hotel, but watch out for bar tab”
Reviews.Author: virtualmachine
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Rome in a group of about 24 people. Spent a few days at the start of the week at the Valadier, then again for one night at the end of the week. The staff was good in moving around or storing our luggage if we or the luggage arrived before check-in time, and then making sure it was placed in our room once it was ready. Very conveniently located hotel. Supposedly named after Napoleon's architect. Some other reviewer described it as stylish and - although it is small - every corner has some interesting feature, and it all is put together in the manner reminiscent of the cramped but efficiently organized quality interior of an older cabin cruiser. For example, there are two elevators but one holds only two people and the other holds four. And they are not side-by-side: you have to take a twist or two thru short hallways and sudden doorways to go from one elevator to the other, and there is a lot of shiny marble walls and floors so navigating oneself from one public area to another is like being in a small but classy amusement park funhouse. If you don't pay attention you could easily wander into a unisex bathroom at the wrong time. Our first room was small, but at least you could walk around inside it without any unnatural body twisting. Our second room (501, I think) was so small that you literally could not walk around without some kind of crab-like sideways move. The bed was large, though, and comfortable. Also, 501 is just outside the stairway that leads to the lovely rooftop bar. Nice night time views of the neighborhood. Waiters were constantly positioning large propane heater towers for our comfort against the coolish Roman night. Watch out for the cost, though. For example, there were 4 people at the table next to ours, and they drank about 3 drinks apiece (mostly white russians, I believe) and the waiter mistakenly handed me their bar tab and I noticed that it came to over $200 US for those 12 or so drinks. I hope they enjoyed the ambience. Some of our group spent a rainy evening in the piano lounge and the waitstaff even came up with a lovely cake for someone in our group who was celebrating a birthday. Heard they had a great time. Not sure about handicap accessibility, since to go from the front door to the lobby you need to deal with about a half dozen marble stairs. Location of the Valadier is a block from the Plazza del Popolo (it is located on a cross-street so that you can come out the front door and either go left/left or right/right and still end up in the piazza) where several free concerts (complete with video screens) on a large temporary stage were held during our stay. Also, on the other edge of that same Piazza is a church that was featured prominently in the movie Angels and Demons (I think it opens at 6:30 every day). A block from the Piazza is the subway station. You can buy your 1 Euro subway tickets at the nearby tobacconist. The Valadier presented a nice breakfast buffet every morning at 7am, so you can eat well and get an early start on touring each day. I used the internet for a fee. I think it was 5 pounds for one hour, 8 pounds for 3 hours, or 15 pounds for 7 hours, or something like that. And as I broke up my stay between the beginning of the week and the next weekend they still allowed me to carry my unused hours forward to the second half of my stay there. At least for a group stay the Valadier was a nice choice.

Reviews.Title: “HOT HOT HOT”
Reviews.Author: catwomen7
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent breakfast and friendly staff couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Beware windowless rooms”
Reviews.Author: BDSmith
Reviews.Content: Very good location. Easy walk to subway and most of the popular sites. Free breakfast had good quality food and lots of variety. Room was small but very clean, 80s decor. Biggest complaint is that room had no window whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: specqueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Valadier for 2 nites. The hotel is in a great location, very close to Flaminio station, walking distance to the Spanish Steps and we even walked all the way to the Colosseum. The hotel rooms are small but this is Europe and you can not expect US sized rooms. It was plenty big for the two of us. It's a charming hotel, in a safe neighborhood, hotel staff was good and the buffet breakfast included in the hotel rate was good. Great Coffee too! I took the train from the Rome airport and then took the metro to Flaminio station, total cost was 12 Euros and took about an hour. My husband took a taxi and it cost 60 euros. You have to pay for internet service which was a drag but at least it was available.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: amoodyblues
Reviews.Content: Be prepared for a tiny room, staff that take advantage of those who don't speak Italian and an AC that spits out hot air. The taxi called to the airport was owned by the hotel. He dropped us off at the wrong terminal almost causing us to miss our flight. Terrible value for the extraordinary price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small - Your're Paying For Location”
Reviews.Author: RoyalSilk
Reviews.Content: This is an upscale conversion of a Roman townhouse so the rooms are VERY small. If it were a railway carriage you would marvel at how they had got everything in there. The rooms have mirrors all over the place (including the ceiling!) to make it look bigger. The hotel is however well located and 10 mins from Flaminio on the Metro on the other side of Piazza di Popolo which means that unless you have heavy luggage you can get to airport or terminii station by public transport easily. The staff were brusque but overall, helpful. All spoke excellent English. With a good breakfast provided each morning we regarded it as fair value, despite the room sizes

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: biaglow
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel before booking. So, my expectations were not high, never having been to Rome. After staying at the Valadier for 8 days, I can definately say that I would use this hotel again. First, the staff were all excellent English speakers and more than willing to help in any way they could. Some people say that the rooms are small. We had a triple, with three people (2 adults plus 1 teen boy). The room was big enough. However, we did not stay in the room much except to sleep. With the sofa bed stowed, there was plenty of space to move around. The beds were excellent. All three beds, including the sleeper sofa, had firm, comfortable mattresses. I have chronic lower back pain, and I can say that I slept well. The linens were all high thread count Italian made. The room was also kept meticulously clean. My only negative comments are that the television set was rather small at about 30 inches, and difficult to see from across the room. The ammenities in the hotel are excellent. I particularly enjoyed the rooftop restaraunt (Hi Res). The food and staff were excellent. I can see why the local Romans frequent this place. The loaction of the hotel could not have been better. Most of the major sites were within walking distance. The Piazza del Popolo was one block from the hotel. The Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain were a 15 minute liesurely walk. The Pantheon was about the same. The walk to the Forum area was 25-30 minutes depending on your pace. The walk to the Colloseum was about 40 minutes. The Vatican was about the same, maybe 45 minutes. We were not power walking. Also, there is a taxi station and a bus stop in the Piazza del Popolo, it you do not wish to walk. There were many restaraunts and shops. The night life was very active, with streets crowded well past midnight. Most of the street level restaraunts near the hotel had sidewalk seating. We sampled maybe a dozen different eating establishments in the neighborhoo. I can say that the atmosphere was polite. The Italians are more than willing to let you sit for 2 hours or more for dinner. This is very different from the US, where they always seems to be pushing you out the door. We did not observe any crime on the street during our stay, and the police presence was heavy but not imposing.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: ErkanDerekoylu
Reviews.Content: the hotel was perfect position. when we get in the hotel a very nice staff welcomes you... the hotel general furnishing is very nice. they are very helpful and smiley. the rooms were furnished well but rooms should be larger. in general this hotel is perfect if you do not mind the room size.. very clean room and restaurant. we were looking for twin bed but they did not have and upgraded our room without charge. it was a 3 room suit which you cannot imagine. incredible :) wifi is with charge.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best experience”
Reviews.Author: Rachael564
Reviews.Content: The service personnel were accommodating and spoke English. The rooms were tiny and had beds as hard as the floor. It was awful. The AC did not work and the walls were so thin...we could here everyone go in and out of their rooms. Think about this....our room had 7 walls and was supposed to be in the shape of a hexagon with a mirrored ceiling. The decor was straight out of the 80's!

Reviews.Title: “The most stylish hotel I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Kristjansson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many luxury hotels around the world but this hotel is the most stylish and best designed I have stayed at. I talked to another guest at the hotel and he was impressed by how must work was put into every detail. It would be interesting to have information about the interior architect at the hotels web. The staff of the hotel is very helpful and the hotel is close to the Spanish stairs. The outdoor HI-Res, High Restaurant & Terrace Lounge, on the top floor provide excellent food and view over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Service excellence”
Reviews.Author: malamarLondon
Reviews.Content: As it was our first time to Rome we checked out the hotel on various sites and they all suggested that it was as good as the rest of the them. BUT for my wife and I , we really could not fault the hotel in anyway, yes it is true, it is not a Massive place and so get down for breakfast early, but it had an incredible style and that is not including the mirrored ceiling. The reception and other staff staff were incredibly helpfull ... really cannot fault anything . Oh and to top it all, they even sent up a bottle of Champagne for wife's birthday, If looking for a tour you have to check out H & M tours! We had a private tour, (worth the extra money if you can), of the Vatican with Hannah and she was very impressive. 3 hour tour was extended to nearly 4 .5 hours with no problem. M&M

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: rwjc
Reviews.Content: Although the rooms were a touch on the small side as with everywhere else in rome, we did enjoy ourselves and found the hotel clean and the staff friendly, but the internet veryyyyy slow was the only down fall. We walked everywhere and there are plenty of places to eat close by. My wife regards me as frustratingly fussy with my hotel choices but we did find this one meeting with our expectations and trip advisor helped us make our choice thanks to the reviewers.

Reviews.Title: “Mirrors above the bed and interesting characters in the evening!”
Reviews.Author: mushyclark
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were shocked to find mirrors above our beds!!! This really should have been our first clue! Upon entering the hotel bar after a night out we were faced with lots of interesting characters!!! I could only really describe them as ladies of the night and we were informed by staff that they were regularly here. In addition at 15 euros a drink that bar was highly overpriced. However the location of the hotel is fantastic and the roof top bar really lovely for pre dinner drinks and 22 euros for a bottle of prosecco did not seem over priced. Overall a lovely hotel but given this seems a local hotspot of a ceratain kind I could not recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Valadier - interesting experience.”
Reviews.Author: Trevorg
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked elsewhere but when I read the reviews (I know I should have done before) I bailed out pretty quick. Mistook location of Valadier as thought it was closer to via Condotti near the Spanish Steps. The hotel describes its situation as being between Spanish Steps and Piazza Popolo - sort of bending the truth a bit as it IS really between the two but about 20 yards from Popolo and 4-500 metres from the Steps. However, it was a good location and we certainly weren't bothered by the noise even though we stayed Thursday and Friday nights. Our main concern about noise related to an air conditioning unit directly situated on top of room 301, so whatever you do, dont accept 301 because it will probably keep you awake all night, and especially if you cant work out where its coming from it will drive you mad trying to find out - well, at least it did me in. When I asked the next morning the response was an immediate transfer to room 402, so they must be entirely aware of the problem. 402 had one of the fabled mirrored ceilings and when I was at reception (without the missus) the next morning the receptionist asked in a deadpan sort of way how much we'd enjoyed the room. I could swear there was the inkling of a twinkle in her eyes. Anyway.........onwards. We found the second room adequate, though tiny, especially the bathroom, but then we werent there for a luxurious stay, just to enjoy Rome and have somewhere clean and OK to sleep, which the Valadier suited well. Drinks at the bar are very expensive and I wouldnt recommend it - just pop out and take a walk. Breakfast was very good with aq decent selection of good fresh breads, some hot stuff, fruit, cakes and cereals. We did go for a drink on the charming roof terrace - all very modern and swish and very impressive. The view is fantastic. The food looked excellent although we didnt try it. There was a brand new super dooper multi thousand pound roof canopy which leaked like a sieve when it suddenly poured with rain and all the diners raced indoors for cover. If I was the owner I think I'd be asking for a hefty refund ! Otherwise, the all staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is quirkyily designed. Very,very dark with hardly any windows, but it seemed very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay at the Hotel Valadier”
Reviews.Author: Ellehcim25
Reviews.Content: Just back from Rome where we stayed four nights in the Hotel Valadier. We were originally supposed to be staying elsewhere but it closed down so we had to book the Hotel Valadier very last minute. We were a bit anxious because we read other people's reviews saying the rooms were tiny. When we arrived we found that Expedia had incorrectly booked us two double rooms when it should have been a double and a triple. The hotel very helpfully swapped some other people about to accomodate us. Our rooms were small but bigger than we expected. There was ample space for us. The room was on the fourth floor and was very clean. It was two twin beds even though it was supposed to be a double but we made do. The bathroom was clean with a bidet and a shower over the bath. The hotel had a great location and we walked everywhere. It is about 30 minutes to colosseum and 30 minutes to vatican. It is just south of the lovely piazza del popollo and has a great selection of shops and restaurants close by. On our first night we did not sleep until 2am as the bar on the hotel's terrace on the sixth floor was hosting a wedding. My partner went downstairs to see if we could swap rooms but as he descended downstairs he realised the noise was the same all over the hotel. I dont think it was very fair on people who paid to stay in the hotel to be bombarded by very loud wedding music until the wee hours of the morning - I dont know how anyone in the hotel would have slept until the wedding finished. We certainly did not which made us tired and irritable for our first proper day out in Rome. Our first morning at breakfast did not go so well either. We were seated at a dirty table. There was no cutlery. We had to wait until we were almost finished breakfast before we were served tea/coffee by a very grumpy girl. The breakfasts did improve as we continued our stay, though first impressions count and our first impression was not good. They also need to fix their toaster as you have to put the bread through twice before it is done. Also they have fruit salad and half peaches on offer - but these are straight out of tins - they should put in a bit more effort to make fresh fruit salad. We had drinks in the hotel on one of the evenings. We ordered three beers, one orange juice and one cocktail - the bill was 50 euro!! It was a standard 10 euro per drink - even for the orange juice!! Bit scandalous! So if you are drinking there in the evenings get cocktails - you might as well since you will be charged 10 euro no matter what drink you get. Apparently the excess cost is to pay the piano player - a piano player who is not particularly good or needed. They would be better served investing in a cd player, getting rid of the piano (it is actually a keyboard) player and reducing the prices of their drinks. When we went to check out we ordered a taxi for 2pm. 2pm came and went and no taxi - we spoke to the man at the desk who told us he had mistakenly booked it for 2.30pm instead - this was an outright lie because he had confirmed earlier to us that it has been booked for 2pm - plus when we had booked it earlier that morning we saw him write 2pm down. There was a difficult customer at the desk around 2pm that we heard giving off and we strongly suspect he gave her our taxi to get rid of her. It made us late for our check-in time and we had to queue for check in for 40 minutes. Also I was struggling to lift my suitcase up the ten or so steps to the front door of the hotel while a porter just stood by and watched! I was a bit annoyed at this as I was clearly struggling. With regard to tours of the Colosseum and Vatican - I would recommend booking with an Australian girl called Hanna Schneider - she is currently with Gladiator tours but is opening her own company soon with her partner called HM Tours - she is really good and much better than a lot of the other tour guides we saw. With regard to restauarants - we cannot recommend this place enough - it is called La Capricciosa. Its is just off one of the main streets Via del Corso which runs down the centre of rome. If you are heading south on the via del corso it is on the right hand side just facing via della croce. The service, food and wine were superb!

Reviews.Title: “Mirrors & Marble”
Reviews.Author: alandhall
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in the other reviews, expect an awful lot of shiny black marble and mirrors in this hotel, including one on the ceiling! There was a distinct feel of being aboard a cruise ship, the room (on the top floor) was somewhat compact - there was enough room to swing a cat, but only just. The bathroom was particularly pokey, but entirely functional. There were a lot of stairs to negotiate, so I couldn’t recommend it for those with mobility issues. In terms of location, it was ideal for exploring the main sights of Rome: it is a short walk to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain; also just across the Piaza di Popolo is a Metro station, which will easily get you to all the other sights (Vatican City, Colosseum etc.) The roof-top ‘Hi-Res’ restaurant was very nice, with excellent food, an extensive wine list and it was not over-priced; but the piano bar on the ground floor was really expensive - €30 for 2 drinks! Altogether, it was a pleasant place to stay and explore the city from, but we will probably choose somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Cool little place”
Reviews.Author: BillieK
Reviews.Content: Rather unique interior throughout the entire hotel, dark polished stone (marble?) and brass everywhere. Nice though, we liked it very much. The room was not the most specious one, but it had everything we needed in it, and all of it was of a very high standard. If you're into octagonal mirrored ceilings, this room is a very fine choice indeed. In fact, mirrors are everywhere, and you quickly become very aware of your own behind - where ever you are in the room, you can see yourself in at least one mirror, from at least one angle. Fascinating, if the view is pleasant. The room was cleaned and scrubbed properly every day- everything was so clean, fresh and polished. There was an electric window blind, a bit extravagant and unecessary, but when in Rome... The hotel is very near all of the sites we wanted to visit so we just walked everywhere. It was easy to find the historic sites during the day, and equally easy to find good restaurants at night. You really don't have to worry about getting cabs after a night on the tiles. Must say, we had a great time, I just wish we could stay longer. The noise is mentioned quite a bit in the other reviews - we had no problem with it, the sounds of people on the streets and discrete outdoor restaurants' noises on a warm summer's night, that's what we went to Rome for! We were too knackered to register anything anyway, after miles and miles we walked, and pints and pints we drank. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, the booz bar nice, but the breakfast buffet was great! Loved the little Nutella packs! Best bits - location. Bad bit - room a bit on a tight side if you got many suitcases. Billie and Alex

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced in season”
Reviews.Author: Mondave
Reviews.Content: Good location. Not far from Spanish Steps. Large room but was difficult to access - Lots of lifts, corridors and stairs. Room was clean. Airconditioning good. Staff not very helpful relative to other places we stayed. Four star but appeared more like a 3 Star hotel. Lounge Bars were 4 to 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Good wine in a small barrel”
Reviews.Author: cc97
Reviews.Content: In Italy we say something like "The good wine is in a small barrel". This applies perfectly to Valadier Hotel. Everything was excellent: great location, extremely friendly and helpful staff, one of the best breakfast buffet I found in Europe, very nice roof level restaurant & cocktail bar with a breathless view over the roofs of Rome (a terrific place for a drink, I had not the chance to enjoy the restaurant) . The "barrel" is small though... extremely clean but quite small. Thankfully, since we were staying just for 4 nights, our luggage was reasonable sized and we could easily accomodate it, but the room available was barely enough for two adults and a kid. Bathroom was just the same, well equipped and spotless clean, but very, very small. I would definitely recommend this hotel... but take care over your luggage size!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Rome & the Valadier (Surrey, England)”
Reviews.Author: Lulu1970
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from three nights (four days) in Rome and have to say we were more than pleasantly surprised by the Hotel Valadier!! Having read lots of info about the size of hotel rooms in Rome we were more than happy by the size of our room for our length of stay - may have been a bit cramped had our stay been longer. The location is fantastic! We walked everywhere, Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and best of all the Colosseum - do take a guided tour as this includes the forum also. We ate in the hotel's restaurant next door on our first night as had been travelling since 4am and the food was excellent. We also went up to the roof terrace bar one evening for a pre dinner cocktail but after waiting to be served for 15mins decided to go else where, the staff didn't seem that interested if you were not having dinner up there. It is very expensive even by Rome standards! Fantastic location - would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “our best week ever in Rome”
Reviews.Author: soxandtoast
Reviews.Content: We booked a week in this hotel before reading mixed reviews here. We were pleased to notice, however, that the hotel responds to reviews. On arrival we began to understand nautical references. We were shown a small pair of rooms, with small windows, which while beautifully decorated do feel extremely intimate. We asked the staff if we could have a 'brighter' room, and were given a lovely modern 'Bamboo' room on level 5 with full height windows and enough space for our son's bed in the room. This room proved excellent in every way. We loved the hotel's location. and the roof terrace, and found the hotel's basement restaurant "Il Brillo Parlante" to have really excellent food, wine and service. All the staff were efficient, friendly, and very helpful throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: buggs888
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice position close to the Spanish Steps. Upon entering the reception I thought I had done very well selecting the hotel online. The foyer is lovely & eludes an Italian feel. Unfortunately my initial thoughts soon turned sour We arrived after mid-night & were given the keys to our room. There was no porter which I expected from a 4 star hotel. At the reception I reminded the manager that we were there on honeymoon and wanted a nice room. To our horror the room was tiny, dark & shabby. There was no room for the suitcases and the room was very claustrophobic.
