We were also given a bed that was 2 single beds pushed together - even the sheets were single sheets. This was not what I expected when I booked a double room for our honeymoon. Besides the location the only redeeming feature was the breakfast. The ladies who run the breakfast are delightful & really give the hotel character. Of all the hotels we stayed in on our European trip, this was definitely the best breakfast. Overall, the position in great, the breakfast a highlight but the room is terrible. For the price I really expected more & would not recommend staying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wjg63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Valadier in May of 2007. Our room was very nice; large, clean, great bathroom. The terrace bar/restaurant staff were very friendly and as a result we usually finished off our evenings there. I loved the location and the the front desk staff was very helpful in attempting to answer our many questions. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel,shame about the robbery”
Reviews.Author: Debbie_Stacey
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Valdier twice now and both times found the hotel charming.Yes the rooms are small but they are very well laid out in a nice art deco style.All the public areas are nice and the breakfasts are good with alot of choice,now here comes the but! When we arrived at the hotel the room was not ready so we were asked to wait in the piano bar until it was.We were offered a complimentary coffee and the staff were very polite.I decided to have a look at one of the bar menus that were placed on every single table in the bar to see what the prices were like, as hotel bars tend to be extortionate,only to be pleasantly surprised by the prices.A beer was 5 euros and a bottle of Prosecco only 20 euros which was the same as the wine bar down the road.That night after our meal we decided to go back to the hotel rather than walk down to the wine bar as we already knew the price list.We ordered a bottle of the 20euro Prosecco and settled down to listen to the pianist who was ok. Imagine my sheer horror when I asked for the bill and received a bill for 50 euros! I took it up with the bar man who smugly explained to me that they had a different price list at night to cover the pianist.No wonder there was not one price list to be found on a table at night so people dont know they are a victim of extortion! The night manager was equally as smug and told me there was a price list available if I had asked for it! I dont mind paying for things but this experience soured my otherwise excellent stay. Beware

Reviews.Title: “Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shirleyPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in October 2007. For a three star hotel we were quite impressed with the entrance foyer and lounge, pity about the bedroom. It was like a shoebox with a severe case of new mattress required. Staff were polite.

Reviews.Title: “rome with valadier.......complete luxury”
Reviews.Author: kairamadan
Reviews.Content: we were travelling with my 3 year old daughter and rome was our last destination in italy .we were totally exausted and wanted something just like valadier...........excellent location ......beautiful decor....total luxury......and to top it we were upgraded to a junior suite............my daughter had a nice time at the breakfast as all the waitresses used to give her attention ....cutting fruits....even feeding at times.....my wife loves shopping and i love italian food and we had a pizzeria right on the enterence and the shopping was very very close......spannish steps right there .....loved it so much ....definately will come back to valadier....

Reviews.Title: “Cramped and hot”
Reviews.Author: shale
Reviews.Content: Date 1/11/2007 Written by a member. The rooms in this hotel were shockingly small even by european standards i had booked a classic room which on entering just depressed you, the wardrobe was so tiny it would not take my clothes and my wifes all together and god knows we were travelling light!! The air conditioning only worked on hot. I proceeded to reception and both asked for an upgrade and for the air-conditioning to be fixed. I was told that the air-conditioning could only work on the heat setting or be switched off. As for the upgrade the hotel was full and that they would try tomorrow. The room tiny as it was also had mirrors all over including the ceiling if this was some designers way of making a tiny room seem bigger it did not work!!! Next morning on asking and i did have to ask about an upgrade i was told that it was possible but that i would have to pay more. On telling the receptionist that i was more than happy to do so he very kindly did the upgrade free of charge. Ended up with the same room as in decor but a couple of feet wider which made a big difference. Same problem with the air conditioning. Food in the restaurant attached and owned by the hotel was excellent(try their salads top class) and the restaurant staff much friendlier than the hotel staff odd but that is as we saw it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location, and retaurants”
Reviews.Author: hauoli
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Valadier early May 2007. Very good location, on a small, very small, side street near Plaza del Popolo. The room was small too, of course, but all of the mirrors helped - we had a quiet location at the end of a hall - no neighbor noise at all - and the window was double paned for quiet, even though Rome is so busy. I had safety concerns, in that I was traveling with my daughter, 19, on our first trip to Europe but the Valadier and its staff put all that to rest quickly - we had four great days in Rome that presaged the rest of our almost -perfect 18 day trip to Italy. As an artist I appreciated the decor - don't know how much was authentic, but the statuary, glasswork and ceramics throughout the hotel were beautiful. The restaurants associated with the Valadier were very good - we ate at El Brillo Parlante, the outdoor - in the alley way - cafe, several times with good results always. A special night up at the Hi Res was a treat - a little chilly for our tropical bred bones, but very good service and very good food. And we were told by our guide to the Vatican that the gelateria across the alley was the best in Rome - we put that to test every day!

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: imiNorway
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! with an exellent location, we didnt use the metro or taxi once. great district for shopping and within walking distance to everythin you need to see in rome. Small rooms, nut suitable for families with kids, but SO romantic for lovers like us:-) the high restaurant in the roof terrace is the most chic place i have ever seen and the athmosphere there is fantastic- Try the french mojito by the way- the best i have ever tried:-) Take the metro from termini station and get of at the Piazza de Popolo, just 100 meters to walk from there, not hard to find at all if you use the map.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed at in Italy”
Reviews.Author: travelselect
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip to Europe which we do every year. We normally stay in 4 stars hotel. Of all the hotels I have ever stayed in this one would have to be the worst. First we checked in with my family. we booked two rooms one twin and the other triple. The triple room was ok except the extra bed had a very thin mattress as it was a foldaway bed and did not stop squeaking all night . Our room was so tiny we could not fit our two suitcases in the room. So the gentlman who checked us in suggested that we leave one suit case in the storage and when ever we need something we can come down stairs , His name was stefano. He laughed as he was talking telling us that this italy and not America. Finally the manager came out (Fredrica) and was a bit more friendly and moved us to another room that was about 10 cm bigger. The bath rooms were so tiny you would have to stand in the same position while having the shower.left with no choice and rude staff we had to put up with the room and the noise from the street. Throughout my travel for many years I have seen many hotels and I know that in Europe the hotel rooms are small but nothing like that. Really the only thing going for this hotel is its position. Never again .

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: topq
Reviews.Content: The high price of the room is for the marble, and the reasonably good location. We stayed for 3 nights in a 3-person room, indeed remarkably tiny, with smallish beds - the third in particular was put on top of the couch - and, annoyingly, no bedside reading lamps. The staff is friendly, though curt. The management however seems not to understand how to handle guests. The first night the AC did not work properly, leading to a very uncomfortable night - this being August. When I asked for some compensation, we were offered an alternative "very nice room". It was the same. The second attempt and third attempts lead to offers of a 10% discount in their own restaurants - a discount that any guest has. The fourth attempt lead finally to a small reduction in the bar bill. By this time, we felt sufficiently underwhelmed that we cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All Rome should be!”
Reviews.Author: LTCOP
Reviews.Content: Rome: Hotel Valadier Date: July 31. 2007 LTCOP, Iowa We stayed for 4 nights at the Hotel Valdier and thought it was marvelous. While the standard rooms are smaller than what Americans are used to, they are beautifully appointed, immaculate, and have a luxurious atmosphere. The staff was friendly and courteous. The location is excellent for exploring the big sites: Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc. When you step out of the marble lobby, you are on a small, bricked Roman street. It's like stepping back in time. There is a gelato place across the street and a great restaurant (Il Brillo Parlante) right next door. They have a teriffic selection of Italian wine, scrumptious pizza, and fresh pasta. The outside tables were so fun! Then it is just steps to the Piazza de Popolo, It was a great place to sit on the fountain (not as crowded as other piazzas) and soak up the Roman atmosphere. I'd love to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Miniature Rooms”
Reviews.Author: PSU83
Reviews.Content: Finding the Valadier with a car almost caused a divorce. It is on a tiny one way street near the Piazza Del Popolo. One of those "you can't get there from here" situations. Parking at 30 euros per day is a short two blocks away but getting there takes 10 minutes because of all the one way streets. Once there, the front desk staff was very courteous and helpful; arranging tours, suggesting restaurants, etc. The breakfast staff was great - cheerful and efficient. My kids loved their hot chocolate. Breakfast overall was pretty good. Nice rolls, eggs, meats, cheeses and very good coffee. The rooms, while spotlessly clean and nicely air conditioned were small almost beyond description but let me try. The bed dominates the room so much so that you need to pass sideways around it on three sides. There is a little "booth" set into the wall that has two small seats and a table top between. Our first thought upon entering was, "where do we put our bags?" There was a closet which held one, the other I set on the floor and stepped over each time I got out of bed. The bathroom was OK, small, but with good water pressure in the shower although the cold water in the sink did not flow for whatever reason. This was a standard room. We asked about upgrading and were shown a much larger but frankly bizarre room down a labyrinth of hallways for an additional 100 Euros per night. We stuck with our tiny dorm room for the three nights since this larger room was a good distance from our kids room. If room size doesn't matter to you, this is a very good location (a block from the Piazza Del Popolo and a 5 minute walk to the Spanish Steps) with a warm, knowledgeable and welcoming staff. There was a good Roman pizza joint attached to the hotel on one side and a German beer bar on the other.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, location, ambience and service”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_N_of_Woking
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two night stay at the Valadier Hotel in Rome. Was very pleased with the accomodation and service. The Hotel is in a great location, less than 5 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps and a just a short walk from the Metro station on the other side of the Piazza de Popolo. The service was excellent and our room was located on the 3rd floor and was absolutely fine - small yes but perfectly formed. The ensuite bathroom had the bath ingeniously fitted lengthways in to an alcove which was quite amusing and all added to the charm. We didn't eat at the Roof top restaurant Hi-Res but we did go up for coffee (and excellent it was too) on one of the lounge sofas and the view from up there of the Rome skyline at night was quite magical. We ate at the restaurant next door - part of the same chain - managed to get seats on the street as it were - great pasta and great tiramisu. What more could you want. The reception staff were so courteous and accomodating and let us leave our bag for the whole of our last day after we had checked out as we weren't flying back to London until late in the evening and they arranged a taxi to take us back to the airport. I wouldn't hesitate to go back to the Valadier again and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Rome on a short city break. Quite charming.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Kmac69
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Valadier on a charter flight from the UK and found the hotel to be pretty much all that we had hoped for. The location cannot be beat. A two minute walk to the Spanish steps, 5 minutes to Trevi fountain and an easy walk to both the Colisseum and The Vatican. We hit all the sights and found them easy to find from the hotel. Rooms were described in our guide book as reminiscent of an ocean liner stateroom and that's exactly what they look like. Small on scale but with all the amenities that you need. Breakfasts were fine, nothing special but the coffee was wonderful. We also dined on the rooftop patio which was very expensive and probably a litlle over sophisticated given the laid back approach of many of the local restaurants. A work of advice..no one goes out to dinner to at least 8.30p to 9pm so if you want good ambiance don't head out too early! The Hotel Di Russi, which is just around the corner from the Valadier is an amazing but very expensive place but well worth enjoying a pre or post dinner cocktail in their gorgeous courtyard garden. Beware the taxi drivers in Rome! Arriving at Station Termini on the Terra Vision coach from the airport we were offered a taxi to our hotel which was not an official taxi and who charged us 29 Euro's for the 5 minute trip. Many other drivers don't put their meters on and will try and charge outrageous amounts. Be very careful when planning a trip. The Metro is 5 minutes from the hotel and very cheap. In all loved Rome, liked the Valadier and we will hopefully go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “A treat for David Lynch Fans”
Reviews.Author: serotonine
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for a one day business trip and we had no idea what was coming up. We thought that the taxi drivers comment "Ah, Mussolinis [--] house" was a sample of italian humour but regretfully, it was quite a fitting remark. We both had "classic" rooms, completely covered in dark wood with a black marble floor, a lot of mirrors, including a questionable example right above the bed and a non working a/c. My room window was very small and could be covered by a massive sliding wooden door (bulletproof?), the window of my collegue was nailed shut. This was also the first hotel i ever stayed which had intime washing lotion (hotel branded) in the bath room. If you do like David Lynch movies, this might be a real treat for you, in any other case you might want to reconsider your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Dont bother - not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: SimonKl
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room 2 months in advance, however, upon arrival, the manager told us there were no double rooms and we would have to stay in a family room for one night and change rooms the next day. The following day, we changed rooms 4 times having realised that every double room in this hotel had something wrong with it, i.e. quirky and tiny shaped rooms, tiny shower rooms, no natural light (in other words windows that faced brick walls), faulty air conditioning, excessive noise from the street all night, single wash basins. Basically, you take your pick and decide which fault you would prefer. All rooms come with dirty mirrored ceilings above the bed and bed-linen that smells musty with the occasional cigarette burn. Towels were rough, thin and small. There was no turndown service of the beds in the evening, but then again, the bid-linen was never changed throughout our stay. You would have thought in a 4 star hotel, a few magazines and toiletries (i.e. more than one small soap per stay) would be provided in the room. The included breakfast consists of stale rolls, plasticy cheese and ham, tinned fruit salads (shortage of spoons) and concentrated orange juice which had gone off anyway. Reception was short-staffed, unhelpful and unable to deal with more than one person at a time. The only plus point is the location, a few minutes walk from the Spanish steps and Hotel De Russie, only one star higher and yet a world of difference! The Valadier claims to be a 4 star hotel. It is not. Service is most definitely 3 star and so is the breakfast and quality of the rooms. Also, we enjoyed the hotel's taxi service back to the airport. At one point we were doing 170 kilomteres per hour and nudging the car in front. could be because the driver wore shades and was on his mobile!!! Still we got to the airport in time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, check it's the location you want though.”
Reviews.Author: JAA_UK
Reviews.Content: Chic hotel with American, English, Italian and business guests. Hotel rooms are small, but to a high standard and clean. Main concern is that it's a bit of a walk to sights and restaurants. The area is the expensive shopping area with designer clothes, art and antiques. When the shops close at 9ish, there's not much happening in the vicinity and no bars actually on the square or at the spanish steps to sit outside. Breakfast is a continental one with some cereal, pastries, yoghurts, toast and the usual continental meats that I never understand people wanting for breakfast. It's OK, but not as good as a hotel where you get a lot of English going and get a fried breakfast. I don't think breakfast is a big thing in Italian hotels. We just used the hotel as a place to sleep so I didn't really use the bar, roof terrace or main restaurant. You may want to confirm that the bar is no-smoking if your planning to sit there and run up your office expenses bill. Staff seem nice and spoke good English. If you've already booked to stay here I would say: 1) You might want to use the metro/bus rather than walking if it's a hot time of year 2) 2 Restaurants next to hotel are fine (they're also owned by the hotel). PizzaRe is an excellent pizzaria with big, good value pizzas. Just cut through to via di ripetta. 3) ATM in via del corso. 4) Alimentari (food shop to get your water for your mini bar) in via di Ripetta (cut through from hotel and turn left). 5) church at far side of Piazza del Populo has 2 Caravaggios that are worth spending 10 minutes looking at 6) Walk to see the church decorated with the bones of the Cappuchin monks (27 via vittorio venetto) 7) Taxi rank in Piazza di Populo. About 8.5 euros to train station. 8) In the evening you can walk to the Trevi fountain and have an ice cream or a drink, but you might want to actually go to a different area such as Piazza Navona. (I expected there to be bars overlooking all the main attractions such as the Colloseum, Trevi, Spanish Steps etc but they are often just small bars down side streets). In summary, we probably would have preferred a hotel nearer the attractions but we couldn't find one available (certainly not for the same price). We enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cup-K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Valadier in Rome for 3 nights in May 2007 and we couldn't fault the place. We had heard that many hotel rooms in Rome can be very small but our room was pretty spacious (number 312, on the 3rd floor) with a window looking out on to the buildings in the adjacent via del Babuino. With the window open it was quite noisy from the street below but with it closed you couldn't hear a thing, and as it was really hot during our stay we kept the window closed and the air con on. The rooms on this side of the building did seem to be a lot bigger than some of the others (you could see by the floor plan on the fire safety card - yes I did read it as I have to know where my nearest exits are!), also when the rooms were being made up we saw come pretty small ones as we walked to our room from the lift so if your room is small you may think about asking to move to another if possible (rooms 308 to 316 seemed to be quite a bit larger than some others on the 3rd floor, it may be the same for the 4th floor rooms too). The hotel has two restaurants and an adjoining pizzeria which is part of the Valadier Groupe. Breakfast was served in the main restaurant on the 2nd floor - a hot and cold buffet – perfectly pleasant and substantial enough. On our first night we had dinner at the 'Hi Res' (High Restaurant) at the very top of the hotel which was excellent and we would highly recommend it, even if you are not staying at the hotel. It is very modern in style and has panoramic views across the rooftops of Rome - great food, good service and a great barman served us the best mojitos! The hotel interior is covered in polished marble which was almost mirror like. Our bathroom was covered in marble (very clean) and there were mirrors on the ceiling in our bedroom! The hotel is in an excellent position in a little side road just one road back from the Piazza del Popolo, between via del Babuino and via del Corso, very near to the Spanish Steps and in walking distance of most things. It took us about an hour to walk at a very leisurely pace to the Colosseum, via the Trevi Fountain, but we got a taxi to the Vatican). Great hotel, great location, faultless service. We would definitely recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Flossloss
Reviews.Content: Our stay took place during an incredibly hot summer and the first thing that struck us was the air conditioning - very cool and comfortable! The room was small, but it felt luxurious and the space was utilised really well. The flooring was cool (very useful after a lot of walking during the day!) and the water pressure in the shower was heaven. The bed was comfortable and the room was kept very clean during our stay. We found the staff friendly and welcoming - they provided us with wonderful recommendations of where to eat and how to get around. Breakfast was ideal, it provided a good selection and the service was very quick - we were well set up for the day. The bar was quite pricey, but for a hotel of this standard in the center of Rome, that is to be expected! I would certainly recommend this hotel and I would go back myself.

Reviews.Title: “a genuinely warm service”
Reviews.Author: rp1965
Reviews.Content: I went for a romantic weekend,the hotel is very nice, staff is friendly.We were made very welcome and the staff gave lots of help in finding our way around the city. The hotel is within easy walking distance of most of the major sights in Rome and there is some fairly nice shopping areas as well. On our last night we had dinner in the roof garden of the hotel. It was beautifully ...

Reviews.Title: “A great time in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: ciccio112
Reviews.Content: Last month I had the pleasure to be at the Hotel Valadier in Rome with my wife. I love Rome and I think is one of the most beautiful and romantic cities in the world. The hotel made a big difference. Everybody was so nice and attentive, the rooms were beautiful and very clean, my wife she is really peculiar about that. The location is fantastic, near all the sites and shopping, big plus for my wife and they have the most spectacular and romantic roof garden restaurant were we had an incredible meal. Yes, I will go back and I really raccomand this hotel to anybody that will go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hotelmanagerIreland
Reviews.Content: I organised a 4 night stay in rome as a surprise for my boyfriends birthday. It took me a long time to choose a hotel as I wanted everything to be perfect. When I booked I requested a really nice room if possible, i was told they would reserve a classic double room for me. I am a hotel Manager myself and therefore I know what to expect from a 4 star hotel and this did not even live up to a 2 star standard in my opinion. We arrived late on the 30th of Jan 07. On arrival I expected the room to be ready. There were 2 men behind the desk who spent about 5 or 6 minutes deciding where to put us. I was disappointed as the room wasn't as nice as i expected and it was a twin not a double which i had booked. The porter asked us to go to the bar and then he rearranged the bed. At the bar we ordered a bottle of beer and a class of wine which cost a staggering 20 euro. There was construction going on outside our window every morning at 7.30 am, if it had been street noise I wouldn't have minded so much because the hotel can't help that. However we were in a back room so the work going on was internal. My patience had run out on the last morning as I wanted to get some sleep before our flight home. I rang the front desk to be answered by a man who claimed he didn't know there was work going on. I received no apology, he just said he'd get somebody to come up and stop it, nobody came... The room was warm and stuffy and the air con was useless. They rang us on the morning of check out at 1 min past 12 to see what time we'd be leaving our room, check out was 12, they could have given us a chance....Not enjoyable and not friendly at all. On check out they had extra charges put on to our bill which we did not have. There was no apology for this either. The only good thing I can honestly say about the hotel is it's location. It is within walking distance to everything. However if I had the chance again I would definately not stay here. I would prefer to stay in a more inconvenient location where the staff are hospitable and friendly with value for money. I hope this reveiw will stop others from staying here as Rome is a beautiful city which should be enjoyed to the fullest.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, boutique, and great location”
Reviews.Author: lylbf
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Valadier in mid-November. Highly impressed. Location was excellent - 5 mins walk to Spanish Steps, 15 to Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, etc. Easy access to Metro and buses. Just off Via Condotti (stylish shopping), and with plenty of good authentic restaurants in surrounding streets. The hotel was slickly decorated with marble, black tiling, mirrors and wood paneling, although in our room it looked slightly worn. The room was small and didn't have much natural light (it faced onto an inner courtyard), but was more stylish than your average tourist hotel. The bathroom was a funny shape, but again more than adequate. Considering this is a conversion of a period property in an expensive central location, you get a lot for your money. If I could offer a word of advice to our American brethren, please please please lower your expectations when visiting Europe - land is expensive, the buildings are old and not designed to be hotels; if you want a palatial suite, go and stay out of town - you simply won't get it in Rome city centre. The staff were more than helpful, and spoke excellent English. Breakfast was an excellent spread of bread, meats, cheeses, cereal, juice, and fruit, with a small selection of hot food. The breakfast room is nothing short of opulent! There is an in-house restaurant on the top floor which is glass-and-metal and very expensive. The roof-top bar is similarly kitted out. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Valadier, and would recommend it for anyone visiting Rome for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Valadier”
Reviews.Author: LaInglesa
Reviews.Content: We were so looking forward to our one night in Rome but were dismayed to find ourselves in this grubby, albeit marble-lined, expensive, 'youth hostel' (where we would have preferred to stay rather than here). There was barely enough room to get around the bed and as we removed the disgustingly grimy bedcover and put it on the granite floor (the only space available) the debris and dust from several previous guests wafted from the uncleaned area beneath the bed. I was smothered in yuk. Pathetic shower in dirty bathroom. The carpet in the public areas was filthy. The airconditioner was noisy and when we switched it off and opened the window, we found that the noise from a huge airconditioner adjacent to our room which serviced the restaurant was deafening. The room stank of stale cigarettes as did that of the friends we were with and the breakfast room was devoid of natural light. A beautiful rooftop restaurant was reserved for evening diners - how daft is that?! The staff were clearly fed up with processing tourists and lacked any charm. Good location but a ghastly experience. Subsequently we have been told that the Capo di Africa is fantastic and the same price as this dump so don't make the same mistake as us!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Set Your Expectations to High”
Reviews.Author: Caryl-M
Reviews.Content: If bad service is at the top of your list then you won't be disappointed. There is no concierge as they state. Upon arrival we were first given a room with no closet and no working bathroom. We were transferred to a room that had dirty wall paper, black mold in the bathroom, and an air conditioner that didn’t work. After several other attempts and several hours later they finally found a working room. Upon checkout they demanded that we pay them for a reservation that was already paid for by Travelocity. (Thank goodness Travelocity did straighten this out). The staff were to lazy to do the paper work. The restaurant is extremely overpriced and has no local cuisine. You are way better off eating at the local Piazza's.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: SharonandSteven
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Valadier for 4 nights on the August bank holiday weekend, before heading down to Sorrento. The hotel was very well placed (about 10 minutes walk from the Spanish Steps). The reception staff were very knowlegable and friendly and our check in was completely hassle free. Having read the reviews we had requested a quiet room and found it very clean and spacious, with a lovely balcony. The breakfast was included and had a good choice of eggs, sausages, pastries, fruit, yoghurts and cereal with plenty of lovely italian coffee and hot milk! It was our anniversary on the day we arrived and we had dinner in the rooftop restaurant. The setting, service, food and wine were superb and made for a lovely night and, although pricey, not necessarily more so than Rome in general. Only a couple of slightly negative things. One night there appeared to be a generator outside the window, we called reception and within 10 minutes the noise had stopped. One thing I would not suggest however is buying a nightcap at the bar. I ordered an Amareto (an italian liqueur) and a whiskey and this cost us £22!! I would recommend going to the restaurant next door, Brillo pallente (which is linked to the hotel, ask for the discount if you are staying there), the food, wine and setting was fab and very reasonable. I would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Definitely 4 star quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: camilion
Reviews.Content: Before the day of arrival, I had asked my italian friend to confirm the booking that it has two double beds. When we checked in, they said it was not available. I wouldn't be as upset if i didn't confirm it the day before. I arrived around noon, and after the conversation, he said he would give us an upgrade to a suite with a king size bed. I had read the reviews before so I wasn't expecting anything spectacular. However, the room was very spacious, the bathroom was with marble floor and the foam shower was fantastic. The only downside to the shower is that the water was not hot enough. The room had a king size bed which my friend and I shared without difficulty and the tv with sky digital is great. We had asked for a room move the day after, but they kept on saying next day, so we gave up since we were enjoying the room anyway. The location is great, esp. at night we felt quite safe walking around that area. It is walking distance to all the major attractions. We had dinner on the top terrace floor, service was excellent and the atmosphere was very relaxing. The hotel decor is not for everyone, we had a huge portait hung against the wall. However, we were so tired from the day that by the time we arrived at the hotel, we just showered and slept. Overall a good hotel, service was standard, and I will probably stay there again if next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, teeny tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Habfan
Reviews.Content: You could not stay in a better location in Rome. This hotel has its back to Piazza del Poppolo. It is a 5 minute walk to Piazza di Spagna, there is shopping galore at the hotel"s doorstep. It took us 25 minutes to walk to the Vatican. 15 minutes to ancient Rome, 10 minutes to the Pantheon. This hotel is literally located in the most convenient area of Rome. If Via Condotti (where all the high end designer stores are located) is where you want to be, book here. Location is definately this hotel"s asset. Our room however was TINY. We could not believe the size of the room. The bed was in the corner at an angle, and there was barely enough room for us to walk around the bed with our 4 large suitcases in the room. There was almost no where to unpack clothes. The closet had a few hangers and a room safe. The fridge did not work properly. (We used to buy drinks and snacks at the grocery store and keep it in the mini bar but it barely kept anything cool). The bathroom was a good size. The shower however was long and very narrow. Not for clausterphobics! There was a hairdryer, soap and shampoo. It was pretty small, but considering the amount of time actually spent in the room, it was acceptable. (Had we spent more time in the room, I would have asked for another room). The walls were quite thin, and if sleeping late is your thing, you may want to bring ear plugs because the cleaning staff in the hallway may just as well be vaccuming next to the bed, it was so loud. The decor was a little heavy on the thick aphosltery and there was black marble all over the hotel. The hallways were all very narrow and since it was all stone, everything echoed...no sneaking in late at night! This is all part of the hotel's history I suppose! The roof top restaurant was incredble! Be prepared to pay big bucks for a meal but the food is top notch and the ambience is great. The modern decor very well done. Whatever you do , do not sit next to the kitchen. The staff there is so stressed out and high strung, that it is difficult to enjoy your meal. We did not have reservations, so we were stuck sitting there, and it was anything but a relaxing meal. The morning breakfast was pretty good. It offered scrambled eggs, muffins, toast, Nutella, cereal, cake, croissants, and syrupy fruit. Not bad. The restaurant next door "Il Brillo Parlante" is owned by the Valadier group and is pretty good and is reasonably priced. Don<t have the pizza. It looks great, but is very bland. Go for the Danish beef....it is excellent. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They also all spoke English. Stay here for it's location, but steer clear if small confined places are not your thing.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Valadier”
Reviews.Author: mc9759
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Valadier was a lovely hotel. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. My room was on the fifth floor where the newer refurbished rooms are located. The rooms are very modern, the kind you find in a boutique hotel. The room did not have a blow dryer, but I personally didn't need one. The room was exceptionally clean and I'm very picky about that sort of thing. The roof top bar/restaurant opened the second night we were there. It's really nice, but the drinks are pricey (10 Euros for a glass for Pinot Grigio). Breakfast was adequate, nothing to write home about. The hotel is close to the metro which is very easy to navigate. It's also close to the spanish steps and all the other sights. The hotel is also located in a great shopping area. There is also a supermercato a few blocks away. I would ask the front desk how to get there if you need to get there. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Valadier: comfort, service, location!”
Reviews.Author: cellista
Reviews.Content: I'd go back to the Valadier again for a future stay in Rome. I was there on my own for a 4 night stay, and found the reception staff friendly and really helpful. There was a small problem regarding my return shuttle bus to the airport,and they made many phonecalls on my behalf,including overnight,so that in the morning I had my booking confirmed. The room (including the bed) was clean and comfortable,the marble bathroom great. Some have complained about the size of the bathrooms, but for 1 or 2 people, in my experience there is no problem. You just need somewhere to get clean and ready for the delights of the city! I liked the dark marble and mirror decor, though there was no view from my room. Maybe rooms on higher floors have better views! The aircon was excellent. One small consideration;I was in room 102, a stone's throw from the Valentino restaurant, and late at night this can get rather noisy("Dean Martin"-style singing!!)..but I found that by closing the sliding door between the bedroom and the hallway of the room, one could get a good night's sleep!I didn't try the roof garden restaurant, tho it looked good. The breakfast, while not stunningly interesting, was good, especially the coffee! I also liked the bar area near Reception,cosy and dark, with comfy sofas! The hotel is in a superb location, for the underground or for walking, with a safe, interesting feel to the neighbourhood.It's upmarket, without being "stuffy". Fabulous icecream is available nearby! There are good trattorias and bistro-style restaurants within easy walking distance(try one of the restaurants on Via della Croce) where as a single female traveller, I had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers, Italian Style...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in the Valadier, and we shall remember it as our Italian Fawlty Towers… when we arrived we were shown a room on the top floor, which was right below the roof garden where renovation work was taking place. Just as we stepped into the room the sound of a drill started gnawing from above! so we were shown 2 other rooms, the final one of which fitted the bill. It was very small, but with a cute balcony. The bed was firm but just right, and there was a mirror on the ceiling! We understand that the Valadier used to be a bordello, so it has seen it’s fair share of passion. Given that this hotel has been given a 4star luxury rating... we expected to find a large bathroom the size of an airport lounge attached to the room. However... this isn't exactly what we found... Hmm, it was 'fairly small' [understatement!] and there was barely enough space for even a 5 foot, 1 inch person to move around in... this is no place to dry your hair and sing in the mirror! As for the bath itself, well, even my legs required folding several times for me to totally fit into the space! To be fair though, the shower was good and very powerful, not unlike a high pressure cleaning machine. Very invigorating! On the first morning at 9am, as the sound of birds tweeting crept in through the crack in the curtain, the sound of the Valadier’s own dawn chorus also began; the vacuum cleaners! I complained to the concierge after breakfast, thinking that something would be done. The next day it was quieter, but each morning after that, the sound of the vacuums could be heard to be creeping back earlier to our floor… almost as if they had a life of their own… So it was lucky that I had a pair of scissors; to remove the plug of the offending vacuum cleaner. Then blissful silence! Please don’t miss the bontempi organ cabaret singer in the piano bar, who will morosely croon a selection of cheesy classics, and bore everyone in the bar with his amusing asides in between songs. It is a clever style of entertainment because if you weren’t sleepy before you went in there, you will be shortly after…! The Valadier’s other amusing virtues include a coarsely voiced waitress that runs the breakfast room in the morning who was delightfully gruff and moody and who sounds a bit like Marge Simpsons’ sister in The Simpsons. I hope they don’t sack her anytime soon. Finally, and of importance to people who don’t get cold easily, beware that the air con does not get switched on until 1st May, so just suppose Rome experiences a surprisingly hot April (not impossible in the days of rising global temperatures…) you will fry in your room. So pack an electric fan! It would be difficult to find a more unintentionally amusing hotel to happen upon, so the other thing you must pack before leaving is your sense of humour…

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the start of April 2006. Great location – the hotel is just a few streets away from the Piazza del Popolo, and a short walk to the Spanish steps. There is a metro stop at both of these places, but as the hotel is so well placed you can walk to all of the main locations in Rome. We walked everywhere except to the Vatican....... The hotel itself is lovely – black marble and mirrors from the lobby to the bedrooms. The bedroom we had was on the fourth floor and it was tiny – but it did have a king-size bed. Our room had the bed at the diagonal from the door, with a small table and chairs in one of the corners. Rooms were immaculate, and although the bathroom was also very small it did have a bath, which was a real plus and one of the main reasons we chose this hotel. (The first room we were shown had a shower, but we asked to change to a room with a bath which we got). The bedrooms also make clever use of mirrors (walls and ceiling!) to make the rooms feel larger. Our room was in the back of the hotel and had a small balcony which overlooked a courtyard, and we left the door to the balcony open during the night to keep the room cool as the air-conditioning wasn’t switched on yet. The room had a plasma TV, mini-bar and safe. Also, there was no noise from any of the rooms around us - a real plus! All in all the room was very well laid out and had good facilities. The roof garden bar was also still closed – this was very disappointing as one of the reasons we chose this hotel was to have breakfast alfresco. We weren’t advised of this until we arrived. Breakfast was served in the main restaurant, and it was very good. There was a good selection of juices, fruit, cereals, breads, cold meats, cheeses, jams etc as well as scrambled and boiled eggs, and mini hot dogs. The café latte was lovely – a jug of coffee and a jug of hot milk that you could mix to your own preference. There are a few wonderful restaurants nearby – it is a very good area for eating out. We have been to Rome many times, and we would certainly stay in the area again, and would certainly consider going back to the same hotel. All in all, the only downside of this hotel was the size of the bedroom. If you can live with that, then everything else about the hotel was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: getupgetout
Reviews.Content: We were here late March/early April. The location is superb, walkable to all major sites, and near the metro if you tire out. The rooms are dark, the decor is tired and the our room needed a coat of paint, but the bathroom was large and the shower worked just fine. We had just come from an absolutely pristine room in Paris, so the comparison was stark. The buffet breakfast was varied and filling - great for a day of walking the city. Day staff is more accomodating/pleasant than the night staff; the gentleman on in the evenings is a bit sullen. The air conditioning system is not turned on yet, so make sure you check first, or ask for a room with good ventilation. Our first room was on an air shaft and the fan didn't work in the bathroom. The cheerful day staff moved us to a smaller room, but with a nice, large window that opened onto the street. Roof restaurant was not open, but Il Brillo Parlante, next door, is quite good, as is the gelato spot across the alley.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern penthouse room...”
Reviews.Author: BrowerNJ
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that pretty much every aspect of of this hotel was ideal. Our room was on the top (5th) floor and appeared to be an addition to the older existing hotel. Our room was very modern and suprisingly spacious. The bathroom was very nice and the shower was good. I came to find on our vacation through Italy that most showers we used were terrible in some way or another. This shower was great in the hot water and pressure, but it leaked all over the bathroom and there was huge puddle on the floor everytime after you shower. I then had to wipe up the puddle with two towels and wring them out to clean up the virtual pond! Other than that the room and bathroom were great! The restaurant was not opened while we were there and we did not have any drinks at the bar. We enjoyed being out in the city and coming back to our room to enjoy a few glasses of wine alone upstairs! The breakfast was very nice and had a good selection of eggs, meat, cheeses, cereals and pastries...very filling start to the day! The best aspect of this hotel is it's location. It is right on the Piazza Del Poppolo and a few blocks from the Spanish Steps. We had no problem walking to virtually every tourist destiniation in the city...even did the 30 minute walk from our hotel all the way to the Colisieum! Also the hotel is in the area of Rome which by far seemed to be the most popular for night life...bars, restaurants, etc. All in all a great stay and would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “I am hard to please, but”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before going I read all the reviews about this darling little Hotel and felt really dubious about going. Prices of soft drinks 16 Euros ... piece of nonsence. Ok maybe you are paying on average of 1 - 2 euros more, but hey isn't that the same with every hotel? Loved every minute of my stay , had read about tiny bedrooms.. ours was BIG... only scary moment was when yoiu tried out the bed after such a long journey and first out there was no bounce to the bed... solid but the big moment was when we looked up( my friend and me..just pals) and there was this massive mirror in the ceiling. WOW. So okay iit was formally a brothel and obviiously the hotel has kept a lot of it's original features. Beautiful wee hotel with REALLY very helpful staff. Can't say one thing bad about it. Bed linen and towels changed EVERY day. Eating places were really good for breakfast and other meals. The location is superb. Hopefully you will take something from these comments as being postive. At the end of the day you are only in the hotel to sleep and have breakfast, what more really do you want. The whole picture is to see Roma... and wow what a location Roma surrounds you. Try the Covona cafe eaterie behind in the piazza Popolo up in the square behind you, just sit and watch the people.. great and ask for Angelo... he's the man. ENJOY! I certainly will be recommending this as the place to stay. Just go and see for yourself. Ciao

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Valadier over Christmas and found the hotel to be elegant with an ideal location. We booked two room for my family. The room with two single beds was much larger than the one with a double bed, but each was very elegant with marble bathrooms and cherry wood paneling. Hotel staff was very helpful and breakfast was the best of the other two hotels we stayed in Florence and Venice. Pre-dinner drinks in bar were only 7 euros each for a glass of wine. Close to Piazza del Poppola and Spanish Steps. Great time!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and cramped”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: rooms are about as small as they can get. room only for a bed. a/c not working well and expensive prices. go somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “small rooms but great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: small rooms but great stay the cost of a drink at the piano is 13 euro and not 40 as mentioned
